info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 26 at 4:14PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Spartanburg, central Cherokee and northwestern Union Counties through 445 PM EDT... At 414 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles southeast of Spartanburg, or near Pacolet, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Gaffney, Pacolet, Cowpens, Jonesville, Pacolet Mills, Croft State Park, Cherokee Falls, Draytonville, Thicketty and Pauline. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
